messages.content:
Categorize this IT Ticket:

no longer available again the invoicing site from sent tuesday re urgent notification old only mode adding thread any might be solved similar yesterday issues thank you manager sent tuesday re urgent notification old only mode hi longer available again invoicing site could you please help sent monday re urgent notification old only mode thanks we re back please give any other attacks officer sent re urgent notification old only mode hi again could you check best regards manager en sent monday re urgent notification old only mode importance high hi thank you for raising we have received similar raised get some feedback very quickly thank you best marketing manager sent monday urgent notification old only mode importance high hi communication below we were advised invoicing sites still be kept active until we successfully transition invoicing moment we re completely locked out could you please restore our access invoicing site immediately we re middle month end invoicing with several tight deadlines meet setback thank you officer sent notification old only mode importance high dear colleagues we two days away decommissioning old deadline be further extended very important transfer your files by date point we only use one order be able download files old please follow video guideline migrate your content by th after date old be archived longer be available kind regards ext hub

message.reasoning:
**Categorizing IT Tickets**

I need to classify an IT ticket into a predefined category like Hardware, HR Support, Access, etc. The ticket mentions issues with access to an invoicing site and the urgency of restoring access. It's clear that it falls under the Access category since the user directly requests to restore access. Alternatively, Administrative rights might apply if access rights are in question, but given the user’s clear ask, Access is the best fit. I'll format this as a JSON object for the response.{"category":"Access"}
